content.description:
Uffda climbs a short overhang which leads to a bulging, sloper section. The rock is good, and the landing is as well.

Sit start with hands matched on the generous shelf. From there, reach a left hand three-finger sidepull, walk the feet into place, make a big right hand move to an awesome pinch-edge, match on it, then move through a series of rails which eventually turn into sloper bumps, crank around the bulge, and mantel on top.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is very good, but it is a little rough due to a rock.
content.location:
It climbs the south section of Eighth Continent's west face just right of

Pleasant Punch to the Face

.

content.description: Sit start at the large shelf. From there, climb up through a series of edges which leads to a series of tiers and an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is a little rough on this one, but it pads well.
content.location:
It climbs the west face of Eighth Continent just left of

Uffda

.
